Module kivakit.microservice
Package com.telenav.kivakit.microservice.microservlet

Class Microservlet<Request extends MicroservletRequest,Response extends MicroservletResponse>

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.broadcasters.Multicaster
com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.repeaters.BaseRepeater
com.telenav.kivakit.component.BaseComponent
com.telenav.kivakit.microservice.microservlet.Microservlet<Request,Response>
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.telenav.kivakit.component.Component, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Broadcaster, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Listener, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.MessageTransceiver, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Repeater, com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.Transceiver, com.telenav.kivakit.core.registry.RegistryTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Receiver, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Transmitter, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.Nameable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.Named, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.NamedObject
public abstract class Microservlet<Request extends MicroservletRequest,Response extends MicroservletResponse> extends com.telenav.kivakit.component.BaseComponent implements com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.Named
A Microservlet subclass responds to a request by implementing onRespond(MicroservletRequest). The response object returned must be a subclass of MicroservletResponse.

The request and response type for a microservlet are provided by requestType() and a responseType(). Parameters to a microservlet can be retrieved in a subclass with the methods beginning with "parameter".

IMPORTANT NOTE

For most applications, it isn't necessary (or desirable) to directly subclass Microservlet. Instead a (MicroservletRequest request handler should be mounted directly on a RestService with the method RestService.mount(String, HttpMethod, Class). Calling this method will install an anonymous subclass of Microservlet that handles the request by dispatching it to the right request handler.
